intro: Thlaspi rubellum, commonly known as red root sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Thlaspi rubellum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats.
